column3: better known by her stage name '''Enya'''

column1: Enya was born in [[wikipedia:Gweedore|Gaoth Dobhair]] in Ireland
column2: the sixth of nine children. She came from a musical background
column3: and joined the band of some of her siblings and two of her uncles
column5: to play keyboards. After a few years
column6: she left together with their manager Nicky Ryan
column11: included an instrumental song ''[[Lothlórien (Enya song)|Lothlórien]]'' on her third album
column12: ''Shepherd Moons''. Her music style became an iconic Celtic and Irish inspiration for several films and artists; the music of ''[[wikipedia:Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic]]'' was heavily inspired by her music.

column1: She performed vocals on two tracks of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]''
column2: which she also composed together with Roma Ryan. ''[[Aníron]]'' was the love-theme for [[Aragorn]] and [[Arwen]]
column3: and the Academy Award-nominated ''[[May It Be]]'' was included in the closing credits. Following her introduction to [[Quenya]] and [[Sindarin]]
column4: Roma Ryan created her own language

column1: * [[2001]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring - Original Motion Picture Soundtrack]]''
